dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small beautiful country town in the fall, on the shore of great lake. Close in on school. [Music: Canon in D by Pachelbel, and angel voices singing then: ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (OS: young male voices) In the silence of our souls, O Lord, we contemplate Thy peace

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Students' choir rehearsing Canon in D by Pachelbel (not originally written with lyrics). Among many, Conrad is singing. He is just behind Jeannine Pratt. They don't kno each other yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (girls and boys together) Free from all the world's desires Free of fear and all anxiety Ooooh. Ooooh Ooooh. Ooooh Alleluia Alleluia Sing Alleluia!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Close in on Conrad]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad suddenly wakes up from nightmare

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man of fifty is holding his wife's hand over the breakf table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know we've made love one hundred and thirteen times?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear laughter (numerous).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAN (cont'd) I figured it out on my Bowmar calculator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughter again. The man and the woman are two actors on s of the local theater. A very conventional play. The set represents an average American kitchen. A man and a woman having coffee. Man is holding woman's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gradually discover the audience of the theater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAN (cont'd) To know someone that well is a wonderful thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAN (cont'd) Two lumps?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [ close in on two couples in the audience] Beth and Calvi and their friends. The women are amused, the men trying t keep awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I don't know everything about you. I don't know your favorite movie stars. I can't remember the name of your favorite perfume. I have racked my brain and I can't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's funny. It's "My Sin."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audience laughs, Alvin wakes up and behaves. Gives a conventional smile to his wife Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I do know, in the last twenty four years, that I have never been out of love with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four of them come out of the theater. The women walk together in front, men behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, did we like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I loved it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bev Walsh was wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I liked them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a comedy. Wasn't it? Essentially?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well let's face it: Clyde Banner's getting fat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He should never turn profile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of us shouldn't turn profile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin seems stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it you were you thinking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin gives his wife a conventional smile. She coddles u against him, but it is cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Car enters garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [car door Alarm On] / [car door Alarm Off] as car doors o and close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth goes upstairs and directly into her bedroom. Calvin notices this, then notices the light under his son's bedr door. He knocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad is lying on his stomach, on his bed, thinking. He composes himself, grabs his book as if he had been readin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin opens the door, but does not enter the room, respecting his son's privacy:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm, mm. Yeah. How was the show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin shrugs, as if to say "so and so..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmh. Trouble sleeping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm-hmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burning the midnight oil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALVIN (cont'd) You thought about calling that doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the month's up. I think we should stick to the plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plan was if I needed to call him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Okay. Don't worry about it. Get some sleep. By the way, I am working on those Michigan State tickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin closes the door. Conrad reflects, then shuts off light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin shuts off bedside lamp. Then kisses Beth. They embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth prepares the breakfast table geometrically (CU).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad's lies on his bed, fully dressed, full awake, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the Warrens, did you call them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they said they'll make it some evening soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at these people. Everybody I grew up with... is in t paper these days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin is reading his newspaper. Beth is preparing the breakfast

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Joey Georgella. New football coach for Trinity."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad's sits up on his bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (OS, downstairs) Did you check with Jane for the Michigan State tickets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin is reading his newspaper. Beth is cooking some Fre toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. She'll talk to John. Where's Conrad? This'll get cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Con!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad's sitting on his bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (OS, downstairs) (to Beth) Will you drop those suits at the cleaners for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't be back by Saturday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth still preparing breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay. Connie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin goes to the stairs and calls upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALVIN (cont'd) Conrad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin sits back at table. Conrad finally appears at the bottom of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here he is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you sleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wondering) Uh...uh... hungry, uh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth slides a French toast onto Conrad's plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's French toast. It's your favorite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... I'm not really hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breakfast, pal, remember? Main meal. Energy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth comes and takes away Calvin's plate right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not hungry, you're not hungry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth takes away the food and goes to throw it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, Beth, Hang on. He's gonna eat it. Come on. (to Conrad) It's French toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth pushes the toast in the sink's grinder. French toast disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's fresh fruit for you when you get home from school later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grinding noise of disposal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't save French toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) Listen, I've got to run. I'm playing at nine. Will you please call Mr. Herman about the shutters? I can't get anywhere with that man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to charm Mr. Herman. Did you charm him? (to Conrad) You have to eat, Con. We just want you keep on getting stronger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I'm not hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I got to go. Lazenby's picking me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin is strangely overenthusiastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Is he? Great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is it great?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. I don't see the old gang much anymore. I miss them. Bring them around... Phil, Don, and Dick Van Buren. We'll play some touch football on the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exit Conrad. Calvin resumes eating, reflects, then :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Con!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But his son is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin walks up the alley to the street. [Horn honks] Lazenby's car stops, with music playing. Lazenby is drivi Stillman is with him in the front and Dickie van Buren is the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Stillman) It's called flake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad just stands there, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Jarrett! We're late, let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrett. Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad gets in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, we're late `cause little Dickie's mom had to pack his lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, Stillman! You guys were late at my house. I been up all night studying for this poly-sci exam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That guy wants a goddamn personal analysis of it all. How do you make sense of that crap, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You read the crap!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit! When was the last time you read something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Right! We swim our ass everyday, when are we supposed to study, uh?.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swim and I study.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a sense of reality, Lazenby. (to Conrad) ) What you reading?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lazenby and Stillman) Meditation!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys tried meditation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meditation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just like thinking, Stillman. No, I don't do it too often.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Conrad) Ain't that junior English? You got all junior classes this year? They didn't pass you on anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stillman, you know they don't pass you on... breathing in that dump if you don't take the final.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man, get something on that radio, really. You know, I gotta study.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad stares at the barrier, then away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DICKIE VAN BUREN (cont'd) Get something lighter for your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Car stops at railroad crossing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DICKIE VAN BUREN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope it's a long train. I've got to get the stuff down. I'm gonna flunk this test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to be late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Train passes, Conrad stares through it and as in a zoetro sees glimpses of a graveyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Car slows down near school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAZENBY (cont'd) Does my hair look like shit, doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it looks like shit. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, hey! Hey, there's Pratt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me out, I need a jump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No dirty stuff out of the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No dirty stuff? (to Janine, outside) Pratt! You have nice ...knees!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad looks at Jeannine seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Interested in something. Jarrett?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowd of students entering school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad seems to be day-dreaming, looking outside. Female literature teacher questions about the character of Jude the story of Jude the Obscure, written by Thomas Hardy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about we discuss some theory, here? Conrad, what's your theory on Jude Fawley? Conrad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad comes back to it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEACHER (cont'd) What's your theory on Jude Fawley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think he was powerless in the grip of circumstances... or could he have helped himself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't... Uh...Powerless? I guess he thought he was, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy was a real jerk. He was hung up on what was the moral thing to do. It didn't make any sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that's a little too easy, Joel. Paul? What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found the book hard to follow. I couldn't figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad eats on a bleacher, reflecting, looking at some students training.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Telephone Rings OS]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad is calling Dr Berger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Dr. Berger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (OS on phone) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. This is Conrad Jarrett calling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad Jarrett! Dr. Crawford at Hillsboro Hospital gave me your number... and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes! I'm with a patient now. Can you call back at two fifteen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I'll be free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then give me your number. I'll call you tonite. Hello? Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, that's OK, I'll try to call you back. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad with goggles, ready to jump. Swimming training session. Conrad and six others dive. They swim in their lanes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! OK, Come on, now! Move it, you guys! Move it! Keep it going! Keep it going! Keep it going! Come on! Keep plugging! Plugging! Use those legs! Use those legs! Lazenby, get with it! Jarrett, keep your head down! Work it out there! Work it! Come on, now! Come on! Push off! Get your head down. Jarrett! Come on! Keep it up! Keep it going! Dig! Dig! Dig in there! Come on! Get at it! Push on. Jarrett! Push on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad slams his locker's door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was he actually a client of yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. Regionally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean.. it's tragic. Really. Look at him now. He's lost everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fish too dry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not too dry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have a new mechanic at C&S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to little Harry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I think he took a job in Skokie. Anyway, this new mechanic is so ...awkward. (to Conrad) Is that shirt ripped? Leave it on the table in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That girl from the hospital, the one you painted with, she was from Skokie, wasn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, uh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was her name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad, do you want me to sign you up for round robin at the club?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't played in a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't you think it's time to start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) Also, Calvin, we have to go to the Murrays on saturday, I couldn't get out of it, it's Clark's birthday. I bought him that book on wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside) Good god, not the Murrays...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad is twisting in his bed under a nightmare

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. NIGHTMARE. STORM on LAKE - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad and Buck are fighting against the storm in their s sailboat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lift the rope off Bucky!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad is twisting in his bed under his nightmare

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. NIGHTMARE. STORM on LAKE - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad and Buck are fighting against the storm in their s sailboat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad is twisting in his bed under his nightmare

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. STORM on LAKE - NIGHT      (NIGHTMARE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buck is overboard swimming, trying to cling at the overtu small sailboat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (OS) Give me your hand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad is twisting in his bed under his nightmare

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. STORM on LAKE - NIGHT      (NIGHTMARE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad is clingin at the keel of the overturned sailboat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad is twisting in his bed under his nightmare and muttering in his sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck! Fuck! Ha...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad, sitting on a bench, looks at Dr Berger's office windows on the other side of street, hesitating to go. He finally crosses the street and enters building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad, kind of terrified, rehearses his meeting Dr. Berg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi. How are you? /.../ Oh. I'm fine /.../ Couldn't be better, really. Oh, terrific, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad sees В« Dr Berger В» on a bell. He rings but anoth door opens behind him. Dr Berger motions him to come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha! Hi! Come in. It's OK,     they all do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. Dr. BERGER'S OFFICE - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr BERGER (cont'd) Jarrett?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr BERGER (cont'd) Come in. Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr Berger is fixing an amplifier

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr BERGER (cont'd) I just have to... wire some... volume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music suddenly blares. Dr Berger stops it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr BERGER (cont'd) Ah... sorry. Sit down! You've had trouble finding the place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr Berger gives him a second look. Telephone Rings. Dr Berger sits at his desk, looks up file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm.... Jarrett. How long since you've been out of the hospital?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A month and a half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feeling depressed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On stage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People nervous... treating you like you're ...a dangerous character?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I guess a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr Berger sits at table, looks up another file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long were you in the hospital?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to off myself. Isn't it down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't say what your method was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Double-edged Super Blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr Berger closes file

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr BERGER (cont'd) So how does it feel being home? Everybody's glad to see you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're back in school? Everything okay at school? Teachers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problems?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-uh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... I'd like to be more in control, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So people can quit worrying about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's worried about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father, mostly. This is his idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your mother? Isn't she worried about you, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, listen. You... You're a friend of Dr Crawford, so you're probably all right, but I'll be straight with you, I don't like this already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, as long as you're straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you know about me?   Have you talked to Crawford?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. He   called me on the phone. He told me   your name and... he told me to look   for you. And, uh... he said you had   a brother who died. A... boating   accident, wasn't it? Want to tell   me about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr BERGER (cont'd) Well I suppose you talked this over with Crawford at the hospital. Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did that go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It didn't change anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you want to change?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, I'd like to be more in control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, so people can quit worrying about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. I'll tell you something. I'll be straight with you, okay? I'm not big on control. But it's your money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So to speak. Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr Berger picks up his diary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr BERGER (cont'd) How's Tuesdays... and Fridays? Same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twice...   a week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. Control's a tough nut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got swim practice every night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. That's a problem. How do we solve that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess I'll have to skip practice twice a week, and come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. It's up to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like being here. I got to tell you I don't like being here at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr Berger nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm-mmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth tidies up some napkins, neatly tied up in rolls in a drawer which she closes (CU). She is in the kitchen, Calv speaks to her from the dining room table. Conrad is sitti there too, looking at his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw Mort Swain. His sister died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one from Idaho?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one with the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she die in Idaho?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess so. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said she was always traveling. I just... wondered if she died in Idaho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Maybe she died in Idaho. Maybe Kansas City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad laughs. Calvin too. Calvin is first surprised, the pleased by his son's reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went to see Dr. Berger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the kitchen, Beth stops and listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Berger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good! You didn't say anything. Good!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth comes closer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know you made an appointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did it go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's too much money, I don't have to go. It's not necessary...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enthusiastic) Don't worry about the money, it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it's 50 $ an hour. Twice a week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, it's okay. And it is necessary. What did you talk about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your schedule? Will that be all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it'll cut into swim practice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's his office?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Highland Park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming at a swimmer) Keep that head straight Genthe! I don't want to tell you again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad is standing in front of him shivering from cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COACH SALAN (cont'd) (to Conrad) Now, this is what I see. I see you yawning, I see you come late. I don't see you having any fun out there. Are you getting enough sleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, are you having fun out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no point if you're not having fun. Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I guess so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guess so...? Are you on medication, Jarrett? Tranquilizers? Anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I ask you if they gave you shock out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. You asked me. Yeah, they did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look at us, Lazenby! Get your ass in the water! Look at the bottom of the pool! You know, I'm no doctor, Jarrett. I would never have let them put electricity in my head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Students coming out of the pool. Lazenby and Dickie, foll by Conrad and Stillman

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God that Salan! He's such a picky bastard! He drives me nuts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody drives you nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STILLMAN (cont'd) Don and Fenetch look good, don't you think, Jarrett?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Con, is he giving you a hard time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives everybody a hard time, Dickie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys don't want a clarinet, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Van Buren wants a clarinet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need a clarinet. Who's selling it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brother. He needs a motorcycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, uh... I need a new pair of shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need a new personality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dickie Van Buren and Stillman leave. Conrad and Lazenby s in front of Jeannine and her friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points at Jarrett) You, you stand behind me in the choir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh? I do? You do? Is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a lot of energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I mean, That's good. My name's Jeannine Pratt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice. Hi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Conrad Jarrett, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Hum. Yeah. Um. Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "You've got a lot of energy."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halloween : Beth opens door with a plate of candied apple ready. Outside, five kids screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trick or treat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the scariest ghost I've ever seen! And the tiger and the witch... You all look just wonderful. Take an apple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go. Be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you Mrs Jarrett, bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Children's laughs.       Beth closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) The Cabbots. Little Julie's first time. God, she's so cute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children run away, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha! Ha! Ha! Ha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what I've been thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin is lying back on the couch. Beth is by his side, a talks to him seducingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Christmas in London would be like something out of Dickens. We've never done that before, right? Christmas in London?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we shouldn't plan to go away right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we talked about that.   We decided on that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I know we talked about it, but the more I talk about it, the more the timing doesn't seem right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Calvin, we've always gone away at Christmas time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think...  I think it would be good for him too. Isn't it time we got back to normal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just started with this doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, so he'll miss three weeks. Why interrupt it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) Because I want to get away! I think we all should. It's important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. If he doesn't go through with this now, he might change his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright then if he changes his mind, maybe it's not something that was right for him to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talked to him about it? Does he want to go to London?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think he knows what he wants to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth arrives in alley with car, takes out shopping, enter house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth goes upstairs with her shopping, knocks on Conrad's door. No answer. She enters in an authoritarian way, then comes out and closes the door. She then goes to the next on the landing (Buck's bedroom), stops in front of it. Sh hesitates, then enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth slowly enters Buck's abandoned bedroom, all silent. Everything has stayed like it was. Beth looks around, sit bed. Stares at photos, prizes and objects. It's like a museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad arrives on foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth in Buck's abandoned bedroom, all silent, sitting on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad appears at door, Beth is startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HA!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha. I didn't think you were here

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I just got in. I didn't... I didn't know you were here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't play golf, today. It's too cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your golf game?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...   It did get colder today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean, ...for the year it's colder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth leaves Buck's bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weren't you swimming today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Sorry I scared you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I swam well, today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Personaly I think I could swim the 50 if my timing got...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans back against a wardrobe. Beth sees it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...my timing got better. I'm a just a little...   a little off with my... my timing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you have to work at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Oh, I got seventy four on a trig quiz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventy four? Gee, I was awful at trig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh? Did you...? You took Trig?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth stares, trying to remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute... Did I take trig? That's... - uh...? I bought you two shirts. They're on your bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth enters parents' bedroom and closes the door. Conrad stands there, paralyzed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth and Calvin are going to the Murray's birthday party, Calvin is driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's gonna be there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. The Murrays of course, and the Gunthers, and the Caines, and... the good old us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we just go to the movies instead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be negative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not negative. That's unpredictable. Come on. Let's really go to the movies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin smiles, thinking she agrees, not understanding she taking this as a joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Yeah. Come on. Let's go. What's our excuse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth wanted to go to the movies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs strangely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car is arriving at the Murrays' house, we see in background

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right now, smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And remember, not too many martinis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gladyce the maid goes open the door. Beth enters all smil followed by Calvin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Gladyce. Will you put that with the rest of them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several guests. Beth sees Mrs Murray coming down the stai eyes wide open, showing off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) Oh, look, we're in time for the grand entrance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello! Look who's here! Three blocks away and the last to arrive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS MURRAY (cont'd) Come on in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While going to the dining room, they meet their host, Cla Murray a thin blond man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clark! Happy birthday! You look wonderful for a 75-year-old!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) Is that new?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It is. Do you like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did the mousse? It turned out well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Partner. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin meets his business associate Ray Hanley, and Man # (red tie striped cream, wearing glasses), and their wives

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, pal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin kisses Ray's wife. Beth is with two women : Woman with dark hair (in green), the other, Woman #2, with grey hair (in orange).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to see you, and where were you at the lunch last week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man #3 is giving Clark Murray some financial advice

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call your bank and borrow the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking of going public.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't do that,      I wouldn't do it now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...because the market's low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth is talking to Woman #2 (with grey hair, orange dress

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your hair looks wonderful. It's shorter, isn't it? I like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man #2   is telling a joke to two women

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said: "Would you please put out your cigar?" and he says: "Huh?". I said: "Would you put out your cigar?", he says: "Huh?". I said: "Would you please put out your cigar?", he says: " I don't have another one!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two women laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to see you! You look beautiful. As ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (full grey hair) It's a macho factor. When these kids are at school, they just think they've got to walk on the edge of danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth joins the two women and man #2 :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are these hushed tones all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just told the funniest joke!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin laughs with two male guests. MAN #4 (with grey hai passes him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not talking to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woman #2 with grey hair (in orange) is sitting on a couch talking to other guests

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously, you know, I have my fingers crossed on this merger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man #3 and Clark Murray are still talking financial advic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When can we have lunch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Fill me in the office, I have no idea of my schedule, but I'm free almost everyday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin talks with Man #2 (red tie striped cream, wearing glasses)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ran into Billy white. Bob Mc Lean's leaving Coles and Johnson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth is laughing, adressing MAN #4 (with grey hair)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You didn't. You're so mean. Isn't he the meanest man you've met?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guest, Man #5,      talks golf with a woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When a ball is in play, if a player, his partner, their equipment or their caddies accidentally move it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Birthday cake comes in with candles (CU)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a jolly good fellow For he's a jolly good fellow Won't regret, can't forget What we did for love

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth and other women and gathered around the piano. They are a little drunk are singing a little false.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, a guest with red blouse, is sitting on the steps o the stairs, eating out of her plate. Calvin comes and sit next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Annie. What's your boy up to these days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Who knows? They won't tell. How's Conrad doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's great. Just great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked Donald, and he says they haven't talked much. I said maybe he's a little self-conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman in green going upstairs, drunk, trips over Calvin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin laughs. The woman goes upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALVIN (cont'd) No, no. No. No. He's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, not far, listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALVIN (cont'd) There's a doctor in Highland Park... that he sees a couple of times a week. That kinda cuts into his social life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALVIN (cont'd) He's great. Just great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Is he still having some problems?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, no. Nothing like that. No, no, just somebody to talk to... that's all. Kind of polish off the rough edges, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth joins in, to cut him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you. Darling? Is he falling asleep on you, yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. He's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Mimicking "Mr. Wonderful") Mr. Great. That's me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth looks uptight and scornful. Calvin notices it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You drink too much at parties, Calvin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you tell Annie Marshall that Conrad is seeing a psychiatrist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno. Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well for one thing, I don't think people hear that kind of thing very easily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, for most people, it's a status symbol, right up there with going to Europe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I thought your blurting it out like that was in very bad taste...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not think it was that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to mention a violation of privacy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose privacy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth is strangely vehement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our privacy! The family's privacy! I think it is a very private matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. Dr. BERGER'S OFFICE В­ DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad sits in an armchair, very nervous, scratching his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do I do... tell you my dreams?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't hold much stock in dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of a psychiatrist are you? They all believe in dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? What's happening? What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just feel... I feel so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jumpy. I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. Kiddo... I lied. I do believe in dreams. Only sometimes I want to know what's happening when you're awake. Come on, something's bugging you, making you nervous. You're making me nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I need a tranquilizer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tranquilizer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you came in here looking like something out of The Body Snatchers. It's not my impression that you need a tranquilizer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad notices a cube on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I see. So you get to tell the time, but I can't. Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm, mmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you know when the hour's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty minutes, fifty five minutes? What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr Berger doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONRAD (cont'd) Maybe... Maybe I don't want to swim anymore. You know, I mean my timing is for shit. You know, he's got two guys that swim the fifty, they're better than me, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha, ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're a bunch of boring ass jocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha, ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And him... I can't stand him. He's a tight ass son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, ah?... Have you ever thought about quitting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you telling me to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wouldn't look good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget about how it looks! How does it feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does it feel? How does it feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does it feel?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! How does it feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the same thing that happened last year... It's the same damn thing I did last year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you the same person you were last year?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why you need a tranquilizer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's up to you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty bucks an hour, can't you decide if I should have a pill or not? I mean, you're a doctor, I'm supposed to feel better! Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not necessarily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad reflects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr BERGER (cont'd) How is it with your friends? Is it getting any easier?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's still hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is anyplace easy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hospital was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was? Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because nobody hid anything there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was there anyone there you could talk to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, besides Dr. Crawford?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad is sitting, reflecting. A young woman's hand blind him for a second : Karen has arrived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Karen! Hi! How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Real good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long Pause. They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you get back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... The end of August.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's great to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you too. Listen. I am not gonna be able to stay a real long time. I've got a meeting over at school. Drama Club meeting. We're doing "A Thousand Clowns" this year. You know it? Anyway. We're going so crazy trying to get it together. I am secretary this year too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let me hang you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Oh, no, you're not hanging me up! No, I really wanted to see you. I didn't know quite what to expect, though... I mean, you sounded...uh, you sounded sort of funny on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) No, no, I wasn't. It was just a gray day, that's all. Kind of... But everything's great, I'm back in school, I am on the swim team, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. You're swimming? Terrific, Conrad! That's... That's really wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't had any meets yet. I could end up on the bench all year, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you'll do great. I'll bet your folks are real proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I get you guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're hungry, at all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... I just want a coke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...   two cokes, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think we offended him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something I said? Definitely a low self-image day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. Uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONRAD                               KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Are you...                         - What did...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONRAD                               KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe how beautiful        You know what I real you look.                            to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really look beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you miss it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiter brings two cokes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAREN (cont'd) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't miss it? At all? Nothing? Nothing about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't miss Leo's corny jokes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause. She looks at him sternly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you seeing a doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm seeing a doctor. Are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... Uh, well, Dr. Crawford gave me a name, and I went for a while. But uh... I dunno.It just didn't work for me, I guess. He just kept telling me all the things I already knew, and , uh... finally, I decided... the only one who can help me is myself. At least, that's what my dad says. I don't mean it's not right for you, Conrad. I mean I think that if it's something you want to do, that's what you should be doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, ya, I don't know how long I'll keep it up. I sorta got shoved into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your hair grew in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. That was such a dumb thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I just... Uh... I miss it sometimes, the hospital. Really do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things have to change. You know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's where we had the laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that was a hospital. This is the real world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, I... you're sure right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really have to go. I'm sorry. I have a meeting over at the school. Drama Club meeting. We're doing "A Thousand Clowns".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, you told me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better hurry. Don't wanna be late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for seeing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad? Let's have a great Christmas! Okay? Let's have... a great year. Let's have the best year of our whole lives, OK? We can, you know. This could be the best year ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAREN (cont'd) Mmm...   Will you call me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You. Uh... You look good. Conrad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves. Then stops a few steps away, and shouts :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A customer is startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAREN (cont'd) Would you cheer up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad sits there with a strange feeling of embarrassment reflecting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From inside, Beth stares outside in the garden where Conr is lying on a chaise lounge. She comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cold out here. You should put that on, or do you want a sweater?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I need one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth is taken off guard by Conrad's reaction, doesn't kno what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not about anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your hair is starting to grow out. It's looking... looking better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking about the pigeon... You know the one that used to hang around the garage. How it used to get on top of your car, and he take off when you pulled out of the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Yeah, I remember. I remember how scared I used to get... That whosssshhhhh! Flap, flap, flap, flap!... Every time I started the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. That was the closest we ever came to having a pet. You remember Buck asked you, he tried to talk you into... getting a dog. Do you remember that? He said. "How about it, if it's the size of a little football?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know. Uh... That animal next door, that Pepper or Pippin, whatever its name is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pippin. Pippin. Pippin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not a very friendly dog...    I... I don't care what Mr. McGreary says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONRAD                              BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - What he really wanted was a      - Everytime time that retriever. It was down the         comes into this backya street for sale. That's what       try to get him out... he wanted. A retriever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he barks) Arf! Arf! Arf!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth stops in her tracks, startled, but doesn't show it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put that on if you're gonna stay out here, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad stays alone a while and stares. Then goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad enters hesitantly, back from garden. Beth is busy dressing up the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help what? Oh, you mean with this? No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (casually) No, I tell you what you can do though. You can go upstairs to that room of yours and clean out the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay? Because it really is a mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand there, facing each other, uptight. The telepho rings. Beth goes over to it, picks it up, seems suddenly delighted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) Hello. /.../ Oh, hi! /.../ Yeah, , no, I didn't get there. I was swamped with work. How did it go? /.../ No, no, I'm not doing anything, just getting ready for dinner. Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth laughs to a gossip. Conrad is devastated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) Did she really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth laughs again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [echo effect to get into Flashback]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth is laughing at Buck story. She is lying leisurely on mattress on the lawn. Buck is standing, telling his story

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh anyway, Mary Ann Ramon started to just scream, just cry, right? It was crazy. We got so drunk that we couldn't talk to each other. It was the last day... the last day of school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A younger Conrad, sitting aside, is listening too, amused

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUCK (cont'd) We walked out of the building in the middle of the class!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad laughs. Beth laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Bucky!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth laughs. Conrad stares at Beth laughing on the phone. gossip gets too funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. Dr. BERGER'S OFFICE В­ EVENING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you expect from her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just don't connect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. We just don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That I jack off a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what else is new? Does it help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, in "The Waltons". John Boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. What about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father came into my room and he didn't know what to say. This is right after Buck died. And he came over and sat on the bed next to me, put his arm around my shoulder. We just sat there. I remember I was watching his shoe. And thinking... Cos his shoe was turned over on its side. I was thinking: "He's so uptight, it's gonna crack off."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr Berger listens carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONRAD (cont'd) And I knew I should have felt something. But I didn't know what to feel. I kept thinking what they say on TV, you know, stuff like:

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CONRAD (cont'd) "Oh, no, noo! Ooh, My god!" But I didn't say that... because I didn't feel sad... so much as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So much as what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno. I kept thinking that John Boy would've said something...about the way he felt, you know. Something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would John Boy have said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad seems lost. Dr Berger is on to something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr BERGER (cont'd) Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hold back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin walks with his business partner Ray Hanley (seen a the party).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. At least she's an improvement. She doesn't crack gum in your face. That's what you get when your partner does the hiring and firing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry. That's my fault. I just can never seem to tell anybody that they're not making it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold, hold it. Wait a minute. That's not the problem. Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been losing you these days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay. That's okay. You off the track?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. I've known you for twenty years. You think I can't tell when something's wrong? How's Connie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie's all right. He is. He's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I am sorry, it's none of my business, but I think you worry too much. You've been on the rack about him long enough. You're making it a habit. You've gotta let him go sometime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not on the rack about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thing about it is, in a year he'll be gone. Off to Michigan or Harvard or wherever in the hell he gets it in his head he wants to go. Maybe he'll decide to take a tour of Europe for a year and not even go to school at all. Who knows?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't argue with "Who knows."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just try giving you the benefit of my experience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Valerie, it's more than her living away from home... She's gone. Got her own friends, her own life. She breezes in ...for a couple of days on vacations, but... I don't know, maybe girls are different. Or maybe she was too aware of what was happening between Nance and me. But they leave... And all that worrying doesn't amount to a hill of crap. It's just wasted energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin is troubled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going home on the commuter, Calvin is thoughtful. He remembers his sons when they were kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me back my sweater! Come on, it's my sweater!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Possession is nine tenths...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, what's possession?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't, it's already on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, hang on! Whose sweater is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my sweater!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK! Alright! I'll give it back to you... as long as you give me back my hockey stick and my skis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin laughs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the commuter train Calvin also remembers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin knocks violently on Conrad's bedroom door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad! Conrad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad is taken away on a stretcher into an ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your back. Cuts are vertical. He really meant business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WS on Beth, hand on mouth, astonished. Beth and Conrad ha overheard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMBULANCE MAN (cont'd) Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lake Forest is next. Lake Forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin realizes he has to get off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another training session at the swimming pool. Conrad is heavily swimming in his lane, although he looks tired and bored, not really fit for training. He stops, exhausted a the end of a row, looks at his friends happily discussing by the side of the pool, then at coach Salan in his offic glass booth overlooking the swimming pool. Conrad reflect

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach Salan is sermonning Conrad in his office glass boot overlooking the swimming pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What it is you want? I don't know what else to do for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not asking you for anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta be kidding me. I don't get it. I excuse you from practice twice a week so you can see some shrink. I work with you every damn night at your convenience. What the hell more am I supposed to do for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bright kid like you, everything going for you. See, I don't get it. Why do you wanna keep messing up your life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think that ...that quitting swimming will mess up my life. I... I really don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay. Now, this is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a big kid now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, uh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actions have consequences.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not taking you back again. You'll remember that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't ask you to    ...sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad stands up and leaves. Coach Salan is disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Laughter]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad tidies his closet. Lazenby comes to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? You all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salan says you quit the swim team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I felt like it was a bore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not a real reason!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's the way it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie, come on, talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Swimming's a bore. That's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well listen, I talked to Salan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, quit talking to people! Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit!     Yeah. Sure. Fuck you. Jarrett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lazenby walks away to the others, waiting. They leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh! Ohh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. Leave it alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you. The guy's a flake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh. Conrad, angry with himself, slams his locker' door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad reclining on couch. Dr Berger washes his hands in background room, then comes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what did your dad say about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't told him yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. The timing isn't right, you know. He sweats everything so much, he'll just get worried about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you tell your mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother? My mother and I don't connect. Don't you listen? I told you that.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CONRAD (cont'd) What do people have in common with mothers anyway? It's all surface junk. You know: "Clean your room, brush your teeth, get good grades, nah, nah, nah, veh..." Hey, look, I'm just wasting money today. I am not gonna feel anything. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Sorry's out. Come on, something's on your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, never mind the time. There's time. Look. Remember the contract? Control? Maybe there's some connection between control and uh... В­ what do we call it? - lack of feeling? Mmm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I feel things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, God... Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes. I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, come on, Jarrett, I thought you didn't like to fool around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't? I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like to play games, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what I want. I want you to leave "I don't know" out there on the table with the magazines. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and if I don't have an answer you want me to make one up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. That would be nice. Make one up. Right now. About how there's no feelings in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I have feelings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Now you have, now you don't! Get it together, Jarrett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you hassle me? Why are you trying to make me mad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you mad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
