dialogues.text: Oh, cut the shit! You're mad! You're mad as hell! You don't like being pushed. So why don't you do something about it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me to fuck off! I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, fuck off! No. No, I can't, I can't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do this. It takes too much energy to get mad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know how much energy it takes to hold it back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I let myself feel low, I feel as lousy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! I beg your pardon! I never promised you a rose garden...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. Berger!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, you're really weird! What about you? What do you feel, huh? Do you jack off or jerk off? Whatever you call it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts at him) What do I think? I think you married your fat lady... and you goona over fuck the daylights out of her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds good to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah! Ha!   Ha...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad falls on the couch, out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little advice about feeling, kiddo... Don't expect it always to tickle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, Grandfather (Beth's father), Conrad and Calvin pose front of Grandmother (Beth's mother) aiming her camera to take a photo. Grandfather is very excited and noisy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRANDFATHER                           GRANDMOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha! Ha! Mother do you know            Be quiet. I have to how to aim that thing?                concentrate. Be qui

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRANDFATHER                           GRANDMOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it in focus?                       Smile. Smile. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, all right, all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And be quiet. Be quiet. Be quiet. Conrad. Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over in the middle between your mother and father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great. All right, smile everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRANDFATHER                              GRANDMOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're taller than your                  Quiet! Will you mother is! Really!                       All right, smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRANDFATHER                              GRANDMOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is beautiful. Hold it               Shut up! Wonderf level, would you?                        want to take Cal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRANDFATHER                              GRANDMOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great! Sure. Oh, come on. You            Oh, hoooold it! can do better than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie. I want one of Connie and his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I tell you what. Let's get the three men in there, and I'll take a picture of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie, move in a little closer to your mother. Okay... prize winner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. That's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Portrait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page one, Lake Forrester...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRANDFATHER                              GRANDMOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't it mother?                         Yes. It's marvel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin clicks but it doesn't work, the camera wasn't cocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALVIN (cont'd) Shoot, I didn't cock it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it. Connie, smile!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a second, smile!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin, give me the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I didn't get it yet , Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, give me the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, give her the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a really good picture of the two of you, OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No but I really want a shot of the three of you men. Give me the camera, Calvin. Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not until I get a picture of the two of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts) GIVE-HER-THE-GODDAMN-CAMERA!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin is startled. Conrad sits in an armchair. Calvin ha the camera to Beth. They exchange places.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth takes a photo of Calvin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) Who's hungry? I'll make the sandwiches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth leaves for the kitchen, leaving the camera to her mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [plate crashes]. We follow the grandmother going to the kitchen to see what's happening. With her, we discover Be kneeling, picking up a broken plate on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it can be saved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth gets up, goes to the table and starts preparing the sandwiches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) That was dumb. It was just so dumb. I don't think he's happy in school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you talked to his teachers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think people want to be with him. He provokes people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. / Why don't you do this? / It's an awkward age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he needs a change. Are you sure he's eating enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mother, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he'll be all right - if you're firm with him, mmm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think maybe he should go away to school. I just don't know how to deal with him any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who would make that decision?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I suppose this doctor he's seeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What sort of doctor... would make that decision for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A psychiatrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we were all finished with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Berger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewish doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno, I suppose he's Jewish. Maybe just German.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does Cal say about all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth shows her mother the two pieces of the plate and put them together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I think this can be saved. It's a nice clean break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The choir is rehearsing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alleluia, Amen. Amen. Alleluia, Amen. Aaaaaamen. (final)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Altos, that last "E" natural could be just a little higher. Officers, don't forget your meeting tonight. That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Choir breaks. Jeannine looks at Conrad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeannine in school corridor still singing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm mm mmm, Mmm mm mmm, Mmm mmm Mmm mm mmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeannine stops to drink some water at the tap of the fountain. Conrad see her when he is already too near, and has almost his coat on. Seeing an opportunity to talk to her, he steps back, takes off his coat while she is not looking, then passes her, putting on his coat as if he wa naturally on his way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Jeannine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeannine notices Conrad passing by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are really a terrific tenor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact. You should be doing the solo in that Russian thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha, no. I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm serious. You really sing well. I'm getting to know your voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you hear me sing if you're singing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I don't always sing. Sometimes I just listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For instance, Marcia Blair can't sing a note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janet Fox only mouths the words and never sings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha, ha?   Ha, a detective?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like Vivaldi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Telemann?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Telemann? Um...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of music do you like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Uh... Modern jazz. I like. Folk rock. Spoon on a glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spoon on a ...glass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEANNINE (cont'd) Oh, you mean like ...tablespoon? Oh, dear! Why do I ask dumb questions? I'm just showing off. Why is it so hard... the first time you talk to somebody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm. You make it look easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeannine is touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeannine looks at him, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEANNINE (cont'd) Oh, that's my bus, I got to go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs and gets into the bus. Conrad follows and see he gets into the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEANNINE (cont'd) I'll see you later! And you're really a terrific tenor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing like a tenor) Ah. You're just saying that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bus goes away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONRAD (cont'd) Alleluia!    Alleluia!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad goes home through park. CONRAD Alleluia! Ah ha, ha, ha, ha, ha, ha, ha. Ha, ha, ha, ha, ha, ha, ha, ha, ha, alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia, Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad enters his room still singing in a low voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alleluia!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He browses quickly through a pocket book, finds the piece paper inserted in it, picks up phone and dials the number written on the paper

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. Is Karen there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's calling, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a friend of hers from Hillsboro?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... Well, she's ...not home from school yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Um...Hmm. Just tell her I called. This is Conrad. Calling. Just tell her I called and I'm feeling great, and I just wanted to talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad walks nervously around to and fro for a while then looks up into directory. He finds Jeannine number, writes down "Pratt 5556719", then picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad hangs up, and rehearses what he is going to say, b he is yet too shy to call. CONRAD (cont'd) Hello. Jeannine. This is Conrad. Hello. Jeannine, this is Conrad. Hello. Jeannine. This is Conrad. Conrad. Conrad? What a dumb name. Hello. Jeannine. This is Bill. Uuuuurgh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad takes courage and dials Jeannine number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. This is... Hello, this is Conrad calling. Jarrett?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... (realizing, more enthusiastic) Oh. Hi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Listen. I was... I was wondering if maybe you'd like...to go out sometime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, with you? Like on a date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yeah, we wouldn't have to call it a real date. We could fake it sort of, to see how it goes..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeannine laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was dumb. Forget it. Just forget it. Now start over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, this is Conrad Jarrett...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) ) I'd love to. When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Happy music] Calvin and Conrad happily come back home wi a Christmas tree on top of car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christmas tree standing in living room ready to be decora Bet silently comes in. Calvin finally notices she is here

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't see you there. What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold) Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rawlins used to have such great Scotch pines. And they all look like skeletons this year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad comes in with a box of chritsmas tree decorations

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold) Very nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad and Calvin stop at the tone of her voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold) Why don't you ask him what's wrong? Maybe you won't have to hear it from Carol Lazenby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I quit the swim team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol thought I knew. Cos why wouldn't I? It happened over a month ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit? When? Where have you been every night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nowhere. Around. The library mostly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell us, Connie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I didn't think it mattered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Why wouldn't it matter? Of course it matters. And...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) No, that was meant for me, Calvin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was meant for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really important to try to hurt me. Isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you have that backwards?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh? And how do I hurt you? By embarrassing you in front of a friend? Poor Beth! She has no idea what her son is up to! He lies and she believes every word of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't lie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did! You lied everytime you came into this house at 6:30 ! If it's starting all over again, the lying, the covering up, the disappearing for hours, I will not stand for it! I can't stand it! I really can't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well don't then! Go to Europe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie! Now, Connie! Connie!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cos the only reason she cares, the only reason she gives a fuck about it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...is because someone else knew about it first!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just stop it, Connie! ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! You tell her to stop it! You never tell her a godamn thing! And I know why she never came to the hospital, she's busy going to goddamn Spain and... goddamn Portugal! Why should she care if I'm hung up by the balls out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe this is how they sit around and talk at the hospital, but we're not at the hospital now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never came to the hospital!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How   do you know she never came? You   know she came but she had the flu   and couldn't come inside, but she   came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! She wouldn't have had any flu if Buck was in the hospital! She would have come if Buck was in the hospital!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buck never would've been in the hospital!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad takes his head between his hands and runs upstairs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough! That is enough!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't do it again. I really won't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in hell has happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upstairs, Conrad's bedroom door slams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALVIN (cont'd) Somebody better go up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah! Oh, god, that's the pattern, isn't it? He walks all over us and then you go up and apologize to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not going to apologize...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes of course you are! You always do! You've been apologizing to him ever since he got home from the hospital, only you don't see it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not apologizing. I'm trying to goddamn understand him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk to me that way. Don't you talk to me the way he talks to you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth. Let's not fight. Okay? No fighting. Okay? Please. Let's go upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin goes, but Beth doesn't, and turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin enters Conrad's bedroom and closes the door. Conra lying on his stomach, feeling all crooked. His voice is muffled by his head between his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a minute...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean it. I didn't mean any of it. I am sorry. Please don't be mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not mad ! I'm just trying to figure out what happened down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what happened! I am sorry about it all. I am sorry about the whole thing. What I said, I didn't mean it. Just please tell her. Tell her I'm sorry, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you tell her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, no, I can't! Don't you see? I can't talk to her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha! Because it doesn't change anything. It doesn't change the way she looks at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was upset, Conrad. Your mother was hurt because you quit the swim team. I don't understand it myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mean just now. Don't you see? I don't mean just today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What then? Explain it to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha! I can't! Everything is German pudding with you , dad. You don't see things!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALVIN (cont'd) What things? Please, I want you to tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That she hates me! Can't you see that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother doesn't hate you, Conrad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, all right. You're right. She doesn't. Please leave me alone, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Then Calvin stands up and goes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about this Dr. Berger? Do you think he's helping you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't blame it on Burger, it's not his fault!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be downstairs if you need me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exit Calvin. Conrad remains lying on his back with his ar over his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. Dr. BERGER'S OFFICE В­ EVENING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuesday you felt great. You bought a Christmas tree, it was all hunky- dory. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't take refuge in one-liners like "You're the doctor". Okay? Because that pisses me off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So everything was fine till you had the fight with your mother, then everything was lousy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I don't blame her. I mean, she's got... She's got her reasons. It's impossible after all the shit I've pulled!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What shit have you pulled? Hey! Remember! I'm talking proportion here. Now, what shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR BERGER (cont'd) Come on. You must be able to come up with at least one example. And don't give me "I tried to kill myself", that's old turkey. What have you done lately?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lately?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, uh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, come on, if you... Listen, I'm never gonna be forgiven for that. Never! You know, you can't get it out, you know, all the blood in her towels, in her rug. Everything had to be pitched. Even the tiles in the bathroom had to be regrouted. Christ, she fired the godamn maid because she couldn't dust the living room right. If you think I'm gonna forgive... - that she's gonna forgive me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad stops. Dr. Berger looks at Conrad to signal him he just said something: Conrad realizes he just made a Freud slip, looks at him,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad stands up, reflects, looks outside window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I just figured something out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who it is who can't forgive who...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well a real problem... a real problem has a real solution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard this all before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't make it any less true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well... that's a hell of a secret you've been keeping on yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do I do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recognize her limitations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, like she can't love me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, kiddo, no. Like she can't love you enough. Like don't blame her for not loving you more than she's able.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she loves my father. I know she loved my brother. It's me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha! Now we're back to the rotten kid routine! She can't love you because you're unlovable. Where does that leave your dad? How come he loves you? You're a rottenkid, doesn't he know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's different. He feels responsible. Besides, he loves everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho, I get it! The guy's got no taste! He loves you, but he's wrong. Look... maybe she just can't express it the way you'd like her to. Maybe she's just afraid to show you what she feels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean there's someone besides your mother you've got to forgive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad is wondering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONRAD (cont'd) For trying to off myself? Don't you sit there and stare at me. What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you give yourself a break? Let yourself off the hook?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONRAD (cont'd) What did I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll talk about it on Thursday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time's up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? You're gonna pull the plug... Come on! What did I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Con. You know the rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rules? What rules? Can't I have a few minutes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think about it. Just think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad is out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin and Friend are jogging in sportswear. Calvin's fri explains a stock market deal he made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say. After going to a new high, it falls to 112 1/4 and then rallies on good volume. I shoot an order to buy 4000 at the market. If I get the 4000 shares at 113 3/4, I know something's wrong.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FRIEND (cont'd) But suppose the order to buy the 4000 shares I put in at the price of 113 3/4, I get 2000 at 114, 500 at 114 1/4, and the rest on the way up, so the last 500 shares I pay 115 1/2, then I know I'm right.I'm going to peel off here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friend leaves Calvin and runs toward his home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you, Cal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Calvin is running through the park alone. Different voices are echoing off screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suppose the order to buy 4000 at 113 3/4...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks all over us and you go up there and apologize to him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all German pudding with you, dad, you don't see things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been apologizing to him ever since he came home from the hospital. And you just don't see that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her to stop it! You never tell her a godamn thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buck never would have been in the hospital!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hates me! Can't you see that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin trips, and falls in dead leaves. He sits up, thoughtfull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to be clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. Dr. BERGER'S OFFICE В­ EVENING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin laughs nervously, all smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the car, I was thinking: "be clear.". I suppose that's what psychiatry's about. Being precise and clear. And honest, of course. I'll level with you. I'm not a great believer in psychiatry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what happens here is only between you and him, and...I like that, I respect that. And...he's better, I can see that. I am not trying to put you down, I just don't believe in psychiatry as a panacea for everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither do I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I knew what the hell I was doing here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you said you... thought you could shed some light on some things. What did you mean by that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know actually, I'm not sure, I think I meant in terms of Conrad. You see, I knew something was wrong even before he tried to... to kill himself. But I thought that... It's clear that he's very smart. He's been an "A" student ever since he started school, and naturally I thought that ...intelligent people could work out their own problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you still feel responsible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure I do. It's hard not to. It was luck. It was just luck that I happened to be there when he tried it. I could have been at a meeting. We both could've been away. It was luck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think of yourself as a lucky man, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No. No. I used to. I used to think... that I was a lucky person... before... the "accident". Mmm, I guess the whole of life is nothing but an accident, is it? What happens to you. I should do with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds more like the philosophy of a drifter than a tax attorney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Maybe, maybe I am drifting a little. I can see myself, ...and I can see the two of them drifting away from me, and I just stand there watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you want to do about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something. I gotta do something about it. I don't know what.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CALVIN (cont'd) I feel like I'm sitting on a fence, and I don't like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you see them as on ...opposite sides of this fence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... No. I don't know. I see her not being able to forgive him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't know exactly. Being too much like her. People always think that she and Buck are... were ...were alike. But it's really she and Conrad. They were the only two that didn't cry at the funeral, you know? It's not easy for me to admit this but, uh... she didn't... His mother doesn't show him a great deal of affection. I'm not trying to put her down in any way at all. She is a wonderful woman, huh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she give Buck much affection to ...Buck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, god, yes, she loved Buck! Bucky got so much... I think what she felt for him was special. You know, he was her first-born. That's not unusual, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?    I   loved Buck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I mean is, your wife's affection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For me you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm. She's very... No. There's no problem with her for me. We've been... We've been married nearly twenty one years. Everybody loves Beth. But, huh... for Conrad, - it's been difficult. He didn't talk about that? We don't know what happens here. It doesn't come up. I guess that's what it is. It's private here. Isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm-hmm.   Very private.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I know why I came here. I think I came here to talk about myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Why don't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin sits in the dark in his car behind the wheel, not looking too happy. Door to garage opens and Beth appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin slowly opens the door. Car Buzzer Alarm. Calvin heavily comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) Calvin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Buzzing Continues]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin heavily comes out of the car, and finally closes d Buzzing stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This will sound strange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I'm gonna to say will sound strange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could we talk about Buck's funeral?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it'll seem trivial, but it's on my mind, or has been, and I'd just like to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was getting dressed for Buck's funeral, I was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin, what's the matter with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just let me get it off my chest,OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What could getting dressed for Buck's funeral possibly have to do with anything right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wearing a blue shirt. And you said: - Wear a white shirt and the other shoes! It was nothing at the time. But it's always seemed to stay with me. And I, for some reason, been thinking about it and it suddenly occured to me what difference did it make what I wore at Buck's funeral?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha, ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth retreats inside the house to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hear me out, Beth! It won't hurt you to listen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't listen to that! No one in their right mind would listen to that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to talk about something I always remembered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you want to remind me of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I've always wondered, in some needling way, what it mattered what I wore. I was crazy that day. We were going to our son's funeral. And you were worried about what I wore on my feet. I'm sure it sounds like nothing to you, but it sticks with me and I just wanted to ...tell you about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes to him and takes him into her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two stairways, one going down, one up, cross each other i the middle space of the mall. On the one going down is Be Caroll, Beth's friend, is on the other. They have to shou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth! Beth! Hi! How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroll! I'm fine. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't seen you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I'm so busy. I promise I'll call you soon and we'll have lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Brad? Give him my love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabulous! Is everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth gestures to the crowd in the mall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't this madness?   It gets worse every year!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-bye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-bye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth is spacing, seemingly gazing at a dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I show you this in your size?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I show you this dress in your size?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... No, no. No. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth and Conrad are having lunch at a table in the diner. Beth is summing up the birthday presents she bought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got Bennett's, and Grant's and Foley's. Ha, Conrad should get something for my mother and father. He's not supposed to get something for his doctor, is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. I think we should go see him, Beth. - Dr. Berger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we could all go and see him together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks it's a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho... He thinks it's a good idea? What does he know about me, about this family? I've never even met him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. That's the point. Wouldn't it be easier if we all talked about it? In the open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what? What are we gonna talk about? Don't try to change me, Calvin. I don't want anymore changes in my life. For God's sake, hasn't enough happened? Let's just hold on to what we've got!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling, that is what this is for. Maybe you'll get a surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want any surprises. I know I'm not perfect. And if I can't go around hugging everybody all the time the way you do, then I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not asking you to be perfect, you're missing the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to see any doctors or counselors. I am me. This is my family. And if we have problems, then we will solve those problems in the privacy of our own home, not by running to some kind of specialist everytime something goes wrong...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Are you folks ready to order?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh, no... Could you give me a couple of minutes, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...running to experts every time something goes wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) I know you mean well. I want this to be a nice Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do too. I want all of them to be nice Christmases

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need time together, Calvin. You and I. We have to get away. New Years'. We can spend some time in Houston with my brother and Audrey. You know, play a little golf. Relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin seems doubtfull. Beth goes softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) I have already talked to Mother about it, and Conrad can stay with them. Please don't worry about it. Please, for his sake, don't indulge him. We need time together. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth takes his hand but it seems almost like a handshake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just give things time. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad came to pick her up, they both come out. Conrad fetches his car keys while she closes her door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't bowl. I mean, I'm a horrible bowler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad wants to open the door on her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEANNINE (cont'd) I got it. That's OK. Thing is, I'm a funny bowler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, listen. We don't have to go bowling if you'd rather not, I'm not a bowling nut or anything. How funny are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a scale from one to ten?   ... About a ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoo, that's pretty funny. Hey, well, listen, I promise you won't look silly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guarantee it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guarantee it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeannine enters frame looking very focused, ball in hand. Conrad looks. She shoots but the ball drops and goes into the gutter to the end. Conrad does not react. The skittle are intact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeannine is eating a hamburger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you ever break the ball?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't break the ball, can't break the floor, can't break anything in a bowling alley. And that's what I like about bowling alleys. Can't even break the record.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeannine giggles with laughing eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONRAD (cont'd) Anyway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm? What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just "anyway", it's a conversation starter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catchy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm, mmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it'd get to you. I've been working on it all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeannine laughs, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think people are punished for the things they do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean by God?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm, I don't believe in God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Well, it's not a question of degree. Either you do or you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe in God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're afraid he'll punish you for something you did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've done a lot of things I'm ashamed of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? So have I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up at him, then at his wrists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did it hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I dunno, I don't remember really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to talk about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, I don't know... I've never really talked about it. To doctors, but not to anyone else. You're the first who's asked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... I don't know. It was like... falling into a hole. It was like falling into a hole, and it keeps getting bigger and bigger, .and you can't get out, and then, .all of a sudden, it's inside...and you're the hole, and you're trapped, and it's all over. Something like that. And it's not really scary, except it is when you think back on it. 'Cause you know what you were feeling stange and new...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of noisy students enter the Diner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing and horsing around)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: STUDENTS (cont'd) Like McDonald's can, nobody can do it. Like McDonald's can, you deserve a break today. So get up and get away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The manager tries to calm them down. A student comes to Conrad's table and steals some fries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Jarrett. How you doing? How about some fries?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some students grab Jeannine and dance around, put a Mac donald's hat on her head. She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The manager pushes them towards the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what's your problem? Lighten up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. I don't like your attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going out, a student pulls the manager's ear. Jeannine laughs, a bit stupidly. Conrad notices it. She sees that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad drives sadly. He is disappointed and acts as if he sulking. Jeannine tries to make it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Energetic. Those guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not believing) Yeah, they were pretty funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You thought they were funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEANNINE (cont'd) I'm sorry, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad does not find this funny. Finally car stops. Conra sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEANNINE (cont'd) Do you want to talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Yeah, I'm fine. Uh... I'll give you a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you? I want you to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...   Guess I'll see you in choir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Yeah. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean. Good night. Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeannine leaves the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth is all smiles, she succeeded with Calvin. They both playing with their earphone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... It's not even plugged in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stewardess' voice in loudspeaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In preparation for our landing in Houston, observe the fasten seat belt sign......

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jet lands on Huston's airport runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ......and please no smoking until well inside the terminal. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Golf ball being wished out of sight by a club. Beth, Calv Ward (Beth's brother) and his wife Audrey, are having dri sitting at a table on a golf course under a parasol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WARD lifts his golf club and demonstrates a clumsy hesita swing, and how it misses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch this. Pessimistic golfer. Pessimistic golfer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ward arms his club as if to strike, then stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Damn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WARD (cont'd) Are we two up? Two?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Let's hustle up. We're close here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never get over how flat it is here. I'll never get over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it's flat, but we decided to teach you to love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is trying to get everybody to move down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gosh, you guys, it's so good to see you. You look tired. Cal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Airplane scotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you tell me why it is I am still hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause you're in Texas, girl. When we get done, we'll get you home. Get ya some steaks on the barbecue. Audrey will put together her famous salad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With baked potatoe and sour cream, too, uh? How long has he had that drawl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever since we joined the country club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revolver fires upwards. Swimmers dive. It's a swimming competition. Conrad is sitting on one of the top bleacher fully dressed, uneasy, while down there, by the side of t pool, his friends, in swimming trunks and wet hair, watch race. Lazenby sees him, Conrad looks down. In the audienc everyone is shouting for his team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the competition is finished. The swimming pool is emp and silent, except for someone sweeping the side of the p and Conrad sitting still, reflecting, looking around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group comes out of the pool. Conrad at the back, as i wasn't part of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am glad you can laugh about it, cos' it sure as hell wasn't funny. Come on, we weren't that bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's face it, we stunk. I don't know how you can listen to that lecture on Buck Jarrett one more time. I know he is the world's greatest swimmer, but it bugs the hell outa me when he does that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stillman, cut it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think he's ever gonna stop kissing the guy's picture?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stillman, shut the hell up, would you? Hey, con, you want a ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. No. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We sure could've used you today, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... I don't think anybody could've helped us today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it going, Jarrett? I hear you got eyes for Pratt these days. You in her pants yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, do me a favor, Stillman, try not to be such a prick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the prick. Guys like you walk around like you're king shit. You give me a goddamn pain in the ass, you think we owe you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad hits him hard with a jab, then jumps on him. They in the plastic bags of the disposal, Conrad still hitting Lazenby tries to stop him. Conrad pushes him away. Two students take hold of Conrad and pull him away, two other with Stillman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Connie. Come on! Cool it, Jarrett! Connie! Connie. That's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Stillman, no! No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go! Let go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right! He's crazy!   Just calm down, uh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy! You're crazy! You know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad walks back to his car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STILLMAN (cont'd) Send him back where he came from!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, now, it's over. It's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right!     Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stillman hits a garbage bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad opens the door and sits down in his car. Lazenby comes, opens the door and hands Conrad his hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's your hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lazenby comes in and sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAZENBY (cont'd) You want to talk? The guy's a nothing.   He's a zero upstairs. You used to know that about him, Con. Ever since fourth grade, you've known it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you just make yourself look stupid when you let him get to you like that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I look stupid, is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it isn't. What is it with you? Huh? I don't know why you want to be in this alone? You know, I miss him too. Connie, the three of us were best friends!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help it, it hurts too much to be around you. I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lazenby looks at him, then opens the door and goes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad remains alone and touches the horn by accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 92   INT. GRANDPARENTS' HOME, STAIRS & LANDING В­ NIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad gets home, climbs upstairs directly to his room, a closes the door. His grandmother hears him, opens her bed door, closes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad reflects for a short time, then goes down to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad enters the kitchen, takes something in the fridge, goes to the phone to make a call. He dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. Is Karen there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She...uh... Ah!... Bill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, hello. Is Karen there? This is Conrad Jarrett, calling. I'm a friend of hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAREN'S FATHER                          CONRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen's...                        I called...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She killed herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen's father hangs up. Conrad suffocates under the shoc He hears Karen's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's have the best Christmas ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad rushes into the bathroom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Very short flashback on Karen]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can. You know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad has rushed into the bathroom where he ends up sitt on the toilet and grabbing the washbowl, out of breath un the shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could have the best year of our whole lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad opens tap, water flows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Flashback to the boat accident on the lake] Conrad yells Buck (who is holding tight the rope maintaining the sail to have him get the sail down;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: but Buck is stubborn and asks Conrad (who is at the helm) maintain starboard course.[The result of opposites will overturn the small boat]. Waves of water

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the sail down! Get it down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't hold it! Keep it starboard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad stares at himself in        the mirror

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the sail down! Get it down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it starboard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad takes water in his hands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go for it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am trying! I can't! Let it out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad stares at the water in his hands

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let it out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep it starboard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boat overturns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad rushes downstairs with his coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad comes out from underwater, taking air in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad rushes downstairs with his coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me your hand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad rushes out of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys are holding each other's hands over the overturn boat's hull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We screwed up this time, Buddy! Dad's gonna haul ass over this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't so goddamned funny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad rushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't let go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't, honest to God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything gonna be okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad rushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on. Brother!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Buck's wet hand slips away. Buck tries to gain hold o the curved slippery surface of the hull, but he can't mak and disappears into the water, while Conrad manages someh to hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay with me! Stay with me! Stay with me! Bucky! Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buck disappears into water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad rushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad rushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad holds on firmly to keel of boat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad rushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad holds on firmly to keel of boat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad rushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad holds on firmly to keel of boat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad runs, gets to a phone booth, calls Dr Berger, out breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (OS, drowsy) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Conrad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to see you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...    I   don't know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Listen to me. Get to the office somehow, and I'll meet you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 124   INT. DR BERGER'S OFFICE LIFT & CORRIDOR В­ NIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr Berger comes out of the lift and finds Conrad waiting the dark corridor, in a state of emotional shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, good. You're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something happened...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr Berger fiddles for his keys in the dark to open his office's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just wait, just hold on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need...     I need...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just wait till we get inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr Berger finally opens the door. They enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr Berger enters the dark office

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. You'd think they'd assume there'd be an emergency now and then?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR BERGER (cont'd) Don't take it off. Just sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something happened!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. God! I need something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you need? Tell me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just keeps coming! I can't... I can't make it stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta... I gotta... I gotta get off the hook for it. I gotta get off the hook!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what I did!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I did to him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's something... It's something... Don't you see? It's gotta be somebody's fault or there's no godamm point!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Point? What point? It happened!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no... Oh, no. I don't mean that. It's that... It's just that... Buck, Bucky, I didn't mean it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash of Buck in storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky, I didn't mean it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash of Buck in storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that, it wasn't your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it was: you said. "Get the sail down!" ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash on both hands of Conrad holding tight the rudder

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and I couldn't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't! It jammed! And then the halyard, the halyard jammed! I couldn't because the godamn halyard jammed! And then you're sittin' here, you're screwing around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash of Buck in water trying to hold on overturned boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...until it's too late to do anything! And I'm supposed to take care of it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash of Conrad giving Buck a hand over the overturned hu of the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm supposed to take care of it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that wasn't fair, was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! And then you say ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash of Conrad holding Buck's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (OS) "Hang on!"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..."Hang on!", and then you let go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash : hands separating

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you let go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I got tired!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well. Screw you, you jerk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad breaks down and cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It hurts to be mad at him, doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He just wasn't careful. He just wouldn't care. He didn't see how a bad thing might happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad things happen even when people are careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were screwing around out there, we should've come in when it started to look bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, so you made a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did he let go? Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you were stronger. Did it ever occur to you that you might have been stronger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad comes out of it and stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR BERGER (cont'd) How long you gonna punish yourself? When you gonna quit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, I'd like to quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not easy. It's not that easy. God... I loved him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr Berger takes off    his coat, sits down. Calvin cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR BERGER (cont'd) What happened? You said something happened. What started all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin stutters with pain and cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ka-ren. She killed herself! I just found out she's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she was fine, she was OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She wasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was! She was! She told me! She said she was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was busy, she was feeling good and she...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR BERGER (cont'd) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wish I'd known...I could've done something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw her once and now you' want to take her on too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That isn't it. I... I feel bad about this, I feel really bad about this. And just let me feel bad about this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Listen. I feel bad about it too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do things have to happen to people? It isn't fair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. It isn't fair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just do one wrong thing... and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um-hmm. And what was the one wrong thing you did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash of Conrad looking around in the water for Buck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (OS) Haaa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad looks at him and cries and sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash of Conrad getting back on hull and clutching to the keel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (OS) Haaa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad stares at Dr Berger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haaa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash of Conrad clutching to the keel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (OS) Haaa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad stares at Dr Berger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hung on.     I stayed with the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash of Conrad clutching to the keel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (OS) Haaa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now. You can live with that. Can't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash of Conrad clutching to the keel. Waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (OS) Haaa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad cries

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm scared! I'm scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feelings are scary. And sometimes they're painful. And if you can't feel pain, then you're not gonna feel anything else either. You know what I'm saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're here and you're alive. And don't tell me you don't feel that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't feel good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is good. Believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I'm your friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad is out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what I would've done...if you hadn't been here. You're really my friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. Count on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad falls into Dr Berger's arms, crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeannine opens her curtains, sees Conrad, outside her hom walking to and fro. She puts on a jacket and comes out to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I was gonna call but I didn't want to wake anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might have been easier...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I want to say something about the other night. I mean I liked being with you but I didn't like myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad. I was stupid. That was dumb of me to laugh and it was my fault. I just didn't know what to do. I was embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?   You were embarrassed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. When those boys came in, it was awful and awkward. That's what I do when I get embarrassed. I laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they were all right. They were just up and they were having a good time, and I let them get in the way of what was happening. It was dumb. It was dumb. I've been doing lots of dumb things lately. I just didn't know wether or not you were being straight with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeannine is moved, she extends her hand to him then put i her heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeannine nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONRAD (cont'd) Anyway, I'd like to try it again. I thought it worked out okay. Well, except for the bowling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeannine laughs, looks down, then looks up straight in hi eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeannine nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad is moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...   Are you going to school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not on Sunday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad realizes. Laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEANNINE (cont'd) Have you eaten?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I haven't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want some breakfast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad nods. She smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go up the steps and Jeannine opens the screen door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CU) Golf ball falls into hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. How about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, oh, boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth is beaming from her success at golf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I do love that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, these holes sure do love you. Oh boy, oh boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should spend more time playing golf together, you know that? Maybe our next vacation, strictly golf. Pinehurst, Myrtle Beach...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinehurst would be nice. I think Connie would like Pinehurst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls back and looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you do that deliberately or is it just a reflex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you said "vacation", so I just assumed you meant him too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm surprised you haven't felt the need to call him since we've been here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was gonna call him tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ward and Audrey) Hey, could we have a little drink before we head back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink, yes. Little, no. (to Calvin) What'd you get? Cal, what'd you get?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ward) Six. (to Beth) Let's finish this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I started?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha! There's no point discussing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think there is a point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He controls you even when you are two thousand miles away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He isn't the problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he isn't. Let's talk about what's really bothering you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. Let's talk about what's bothering you. Cos' that's what you want, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, what have I done to make you so angry with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not what you've done, it's what you think I've done. You blame me for the whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you see anything except in terms of how it affects you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I can't! And neither can you, and neither can anybody else! Only maybe I'm just a little more honest about it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, stop being so godamn honest, and start being a little generous! And start thinking about him for a while!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what he expects from me. I never have known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'll tell you what he expects!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
