dialogues.text: What? He wants me to throw my arms around him everytime he passes an exam? Well, I can't do it! I cannot respond when someone says: "Here, I just did this great thing. Love me.". I can't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All he wants... All he wants is to know you don't hate him. That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hate him? My God! How could I hate him? Mothers don't hate their sons! Is that what he told you? Do you see how you accept what he says with no questions, and you can't do the same thing to me, can you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just try to keep this family together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she shouts) I don't know what everyone wants from me anymore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, nobody wants anything from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, listen. We all just want... Cal, Con, everybody, we just want you to be happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ward, you tell me the definition of happy, uh? But first, you better make sure that your kids are good and safe, that no one's fallen off a horse, or been hit by a car, or drowned in that swimming pool you're so proud of! And then you come to me and tell me how to be happy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves. Calvin follows. Ward and his wife just stand there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth stares away from Calvin, as in a void. She sighs, cl her eyes; Calvin turns away from the window, looks at Bet and remembers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they were happily dancing...    [ to and fro twice]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin in his plane seat, reflects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth checks a pile of mail. Conrad comes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm gonna turn in. Dinner was good. Really good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pretty early. You tired?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It was kind of a rough week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope your grandmother wasn't too tough on you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She was fine. I'm glad you're back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad gives his mother a hug, but she is like made of st Calvin sees it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONRAD (cont'd) Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth remains transfixed as if she didn't know what it was about. Calvin sees it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth is not sleeping, she looks up, sees her husband wrin pillow, but he is not in bed. She looks at the time, gets puts on a robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth goes downstairs, tying up her robe. She stops, heari someone sobbing in the dark, in the dining room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth enters the dining room in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin is sitting at table in the dark, sobbing, his head his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) Why are you crying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) Can I, uh... Can I get you something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin mutters in a very low voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin sits back in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) Calvin. What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin produces a very deep sigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin looks up at her with a sad expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are beautiful. And you are unpredictable. But you're so cautious. You're determined, Beth. But you know something? You're not strong. And I don't know if you're really giving. Beth is looking at him not knowing what this is about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALVIN (cont'd) Tell me something. Do you love me? Do you really love me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel the way I've always felt about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin is disappointed by the answer, but not surprised, sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We would've been all right, if there hadn't been any ...mess. But you can't handle mess. You need everything neat and ...easy. I don't know. Maybe you can't love anybody. It was so much Buck. And Buck died, it was as if you buried all your love with him, and I don't understand that. I just don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALVIN (cont'd) Maybe it wasn't even Buck. Maybe it was just you. Maybe, finally, it was the best of you that you buried.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CALVIN (cont'd) But whatever it was, I don't know who you are. I don't know what we've been playing at. So I was crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin is overcome by sadness

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALVIN (cont'd) 't know if I love you anymore. And I don't know what I am going to do without that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth does not know what to say or do. She turns away and upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth enters, kind of reflects, then goes open a closet, t out some luggage. A sudden burst of emotion overcomes her she cries but does not seem to identify the emotion, then restrains it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his bed Conrad is not sleeping. He hears the door of t house close, then someone walking outside on the gravel. gets up, go look out of the window. Ouside, a taxi leaves goes downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conrad goes downstairs, curious. Looks around, sees nobod

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From inside, Conrad finally sees his father in the garden reflecting. Patches of snow. Conrad puts on his coat over his pyjamas, and joins him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The yard looks smaller without leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother's going away for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?   Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to Houston. Then I... I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? What... I know why.   It's me. Isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it is. It's my fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do that! Don't do that to yourself! It's nobody's fault! Things happen in this world, people don't always have answers for them, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALVIN (cont'd) I don't know why I'm yelling at you for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's right! You're right! You ought to do that more often.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, Haul my ass a little, you know. Get after me. The way you used to for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he needed it. You didn't. You were always so hard on yourself, I never had the heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Dad. Don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's the truth. I... I never worried about you. I just wasn't listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I wasn't putting out many signals then. I don't think you could have done anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no, I should ...I should've got a handle on it somehow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I used to figure you had a handle for everything. You knew it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin looks at him and laughs briefly at himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONRAD (cont'd) I know that wasn't fair but you always made us feel like everything was gonna be all right. I thought about that a lot lately. I really admire you for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin is moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't admire people too much. They'll disappoint you sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not disappointed. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin looks at him, cries and takes him in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hug each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [ Camera pulls back / Canon in D by Pachelbel ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Credits roll.
